text: Break 3 whole eggs into a bowl and fluff them with a fork.  Add 1 1/4 cup (10oz) whole milk and 1/2 tsp. (2.5ml) vanilla and fluff again until well blended. For a lower fat option, you may substitute 1 1/2 cup (12oz) of fat free milk. Take a second bowl and mix together 1 cup (128g) flour, 1/2 tsp. (2.5ml) salt and 1 to 2 tbs. sugar. Add the milk and egg mixture to the dry ingredients gradually using a beater.  Add 3 tbs. (45ml) melted butter or 1 tbs. (15ml) oil and mix until the batter is smooth. Refrigerate the batter for at least 1 hour.  Heat a non-stick 8-inch skillet, lightly greased with oil or cooking spray.  Pour about 1/4 cup of batter into the heated skillet. You will have to tilt the pan all around until the entire bottom of the skillet is covered evenly. Cook over medium to medium-high heat until no liquid shows on top. Some choose to flip the pancake at this time, while others only cook on one side, leaving the top a bit softer. Cook one at a time, until all of your batter has been used. As each pancake is finished, stack them on a plate and cover with a towel to keep them from drying out. Fill each pancake with 2 to 3 tbs. of desired filling and roll up, making sure to fold in the ends. Repeat until all the pancakes have been filled. If you are not yet ready to serve your blintzes, you may cover them with plastic wrap and refrigerate them for a few hours or even overnight. Rub or spray your skillet with oil and heat 2 or 3 filled blintzes until brown.  Turn over and brown on the other side.  Repeat until all blintzes are brown.  Top with whipped cream, berries or other desired topping.  Serve warm and enjoy.
